thread.title: Six Flags theme park launches trailer for 2016's rides
thread.title_full: Six Flags theme park launches trailer for 2016's rides | Daily Mail Online

author: Becky Pemberton For Mailonline
title: Six Flags theme park launches trailer for 2016's rides
text:
24 shares 7
View
comments
From a roller coaster based on the villainous Joker to a 4D 'free spin' ride that flips riders head-over-heels, these are the thrilling rides planned for Six Flags theme parks in the US next year.
The firm - which operates 18 parks across the United States, Mexico and Canada - announced its plans for even more stomach-churning and high-thrill coasters yesterday.
The highly anticipated The Joker ride will mimic the antagonist's chaotic personality, throwing guests around with twists and turns along its 3,200-foot track, it said.

Six Flags Discovery Kingdom in Northern California will transform its Roar coaster into The Joker, a wooden-steel hybrid coaster
The Joker ride will mimic the antagonist's chaotic personality, throwing guests around twists and turns along its 3,200 feet track
And a ride based on Batman's nemesis would not be complete without some unexpected thrills.
 2 Next Do you wish your holiday pictures looked like this?... He's in peak condition: Daredevil's terrifying footage of... The female solo backpacker who braved a turbulent Syria to... Are we there yet? 'Big Crazy Family Adventure' sees parents... Featuring the world's first 'step-up under-flip inverted roll' manoeuvre, guests will experience 'wild Zero G rolls over 15 airtime moments' on the Six Flags Discovery Kingdom attraction in California, a statement revealed.
At the world's biggest theme park, Six Flags Great Adventure in New Jersey, a 14th coaster will join the throng.
Total Mayhem is a wacky – and terrifying – attraction coming to Six Flags Great Adventure in New Jersey next spring
Riders will spin at least six times during the ride, which places seats next to the track instead of above it
Riders on Total Mayhem will soar straight up a 12-storey, 90-degree hill, and will be flipped head-over-heels
Riders on Total Mayhem will soar straight up a 12-storey, 90-degree hill, and will be flipped head-over-heels at least six times during the experience.
The '4-D free-fly ride' looks like it could be the ultimate vertigo-inducing experience.
And this is not the only 4D ride that the company will be launching.
The interactive 4D Justice League: Battle for Metropolis is coming to Six Flags Great America and Six Flags Mexico
Riders will be immersed in a full-sensory journey, battling alongside superheroes, in this 4D ride
Both Six Flags Great America in Chicago and Six Flags Mexico will debut Justice League: Battle for Metropolis.
Recently awarded Best New Attraction by Theme Park Insider, riders will be immersed in 'a full-sensory journey'.
The interactive experience will see riders try to save the city of Metropolis as they outsmart the villains, using laser guns to shoot targets on high-definition screens.
The Riddler Revenge is one of three news rides in the Gotham City section of Six Flags Over Texas
Expansion with the Batman theme is continued as not one, but three rides are added to the Gotham City section at Six Flags Over Texas.
Opening in 2016, the park is debuting an area dedicated to the ultimate battle of Batman versus villains with new rides, The Riddler Revenge, Catwoman Whip and Harley Quinn Spinsanity.
Six Flags Over Georgia is poised for 12 new rides and attractions, with the world's first DC Super Friends themed area and the all-new Bugs Bunny Boomtown.
Prepare for a splash with the colourful Wahoo Racer water slides which will be opening at Six Flags White Water in Georgia in 2016
Riders will be able to soar down a series of racing slides, which reach 60 feet in height
Meanwhile, Six Flags White Water in Georgia is gaining a 60-foot tall exhilarating Wahoo Racer water slide.
The statement said: 'Riders will experience the thrill of racing against their friends and family members reaching speeds of up to 40 feet per second on six aero-dynamic designed water toboggans.'
Another water attraction being added to the Six Flags collection is a giant interactive water playground, Splashwater Falls, at Six Flags America.
And trains are being flipped to run backwards on the iconic Vampire coaster at La Ronde in Montreal, with two other rides introduced in an all-new section of the park, called Avenue Aventure.
Described as 360 degrees of pure adrenaline, the looping ride Fireball will be heating things up at Six Flags St. Louis in 2016 and Six Flags Fiesta Texas
Things are heating up at Six Flags St. Louis, with an all-new seven-storey tall Fireball looping thrill ride.
Travelling back to back in unique 'face-off' seating, guests will soar through a series of 360 degree revolutions stopping upside down before reversing directions.
Meanwhile at Six Flags Fiesta Texas there will be three new rides, the firm announced, with a Fireball ride debuting in the park, along with a Hurricane Force 5 ride swirling guests into the air.
The Fireball ride sees riders actually face each other as they hurtle around the loop
A new twist on an iconic classic: The Vampire ride in Montreal is now set to run backwards
Providing new twists on an iconic favourite is Six Flags New England who is relaunching its steel coaster Bizarro as Superman the Ride, featuring superhero music and theming
Six Flags Entertainment Corporation is the world's largest regional theme park company with $1.2 billion in revenue.
'Our rides and attractions are consistently ranked as the most thrilling and innovative in the regional theme park industry and our 2016 line-up will build on that success,' said Six Flags' Chairman, President and CEO, Jim Reid-Anderson.
'For five years we have maintained our strategy of introducing something new at every park, every year, delighting our guests with differentiated new attractions and experiences.
'It is clear our strategy is working – guests are thrilled by the continuous stream of exciting new attractions and park upgrades and we look forward to wowing them again next spring with our 2016 offerings.'
